subject: Ethics
title: Banned Weapons and Why
description: A quick, practical guide to Banned Weapons and Why.

hook.text: Mustard gas melts your lungs from the inside. It was banned in 1925, but countries still make it.

buildup.text: Chemical, biological, and certain conventional weapons are banned because they cause needless suffering.

discovery.text: Blinding lasers, expanding bullets, and cluster bombs are all restricted by international treaties.

twist.text: Landmines kill 15,000 people yearlyâ€”mostly civilians, decades after wars end. The U.S. hasn't banned them.

climax.text: Weapons are banned not because killing is wrong in war, but because some ways of killing are too cruel.

punchline.text: War allows killing but draws the line at cruelty.

quiz.question: Why are certain weapons banned in warfare?
options: Because they cause needless suffering beyond military necessity
Because all killing in war is considered illegal
Because they are too expensive for poorer nations to use
